pages.text: Three displays for your weapon balance curiosity. Shift, Alt and possibly control.
pages.title: Checking Your Gear

pages.text: In War dance, not all weapons are quite the same. Unlike vanilla where most weapons are functionally similar, War Dance hopes to mix up your actual options by provided a number of stats with which to craft yourself a combat style and strategy.$(br2)This is most obviously observed when you inspect any items which have been configured to work by your pack makers or provided by Darkmega's cross compatibility patch linked on War dance's main page.

Upon holding shift, you may see various stats such as: $(o)"posture per attack"$(), or $(o)"defense posture multiplier"$(). $(br2)Put simply, posture per attack is the damage the weapon would normally deal when attacked with at full charge with no bonuses from passive skills or sweep types. You may also notice a number of layers of further words such as $(o)when standing, when falling$() etc; these dictate the various attack states a player can utilize to morph a weapon's sweep area and deal varying levels of damage in different area sizes, as part of their $(l:footwork:selfdefense/movesets)"moveset"$()

Defense posture multiplier is the change to posture damage taken when $(l:footwork:selfdefense/parry0)parrying$() a blow with that weapon or tool.$(br2)On some tools and weapons you can hold alt to check its other special properties. For example, any shield or item which can act as a shield, disable a shield, or must be wielded in two hands will display it in here.$(br2)

Holding ctrl you can inspect a weapon for the bonuses that you'll acquire for $(l:footwork:selfdefense/solowielding)Two-Handing$() the weapon. $(br2)The various attributes are a mixture of vanilla and footwork based stats.
